A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Dumb fun is the best way I can describe this movie. There were some genuinely exciting and enjoyable moments like the opening sequence\, a certain light speed jump and there were some good parts on the island. But there were many times where I couldn't help but slap my palm to my face like every time we cut back to slowest chase sequence in cinematic history\, the entirety of Finn's B story at the Casino\, Snoke's Hue Hefner robe and red colored love room\, and of course a really silly Force moment that was supposed to be powerful but had the whole theater cracking up. Not to mention plot holes so big that light couldn't escape. Overall\, I had a little fun in a handful of parts\, but it was lacking a lot of the emotion I was hoping for and the story could have been a lot cleaner. Like with The Force Awakens\, I saw it once and that's all I need. I don't feel like I'll have the urge to ever watch it again.
